intro: Hieracium cambricum, commonly known as the Welsh groundsel, is a flowering plant native to western Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has hairy, serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium cambricum is often found in meadows and along riverbanks, where it thrives in damp conditions.
